name: Glib
tagline: A simple general purpose C# library covering windows forms, XNA, extension methods, and more.
body: ## Welcome to Glib This library simplifies usage of various APIs available in C#, such as XNA, Windows Forms, and conversions to common types, such as integer. For example, to parse a string as an integer, you can just run: `"Your string".ToInt()`. ## Users of our library This library is currently being used by: * [PGCGame](https://github.com/GreatMindsRobotics/PGCGame) If you are using this library and want to be on this page, please contact @glen3b. ## Downloads ### Cross-platform binaries * Desktop DLL * Desktop documentation * XBOX DLL * XBOX documentation ## Building from source To build this library from source, you need a C# compiler at least (I recommend getting the IDE [Visual C# express 2010](http://go.microsoft.com/?linkid=9709939)) and, to build the full library (including XNA components), [XNA game studio 4.0](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/confirmation.aspx?id=23714) or [later](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/confirmation.aspx?id=27599). This project includes a Visual Studio C# Express 2010 solution file. To not include XNA components, delete the XNA folder in your copy. Be sure not to include that change in a pull request! ## Documentation Docs are available as XML documentation when you build the project, or are in development on the [wiki](https://github.com/glen3b/Glib/wiki).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
